content:
Certainly, here are ten music writers who have recently covered emerging artists in similar genres to Sunstoney:

1. Rachel Brodsky - Brodsky is a writer and editor who has written for a number of publications, including Billboard, Rolling Stone, and Stereogum. She has covered a range of genres, with a focus on indie and alternative music.
2. Margaret Farrell - Farrell is a writer who has contributed to publications like Pitchfork and The Line of Best Fit. She covers a range of genres, with a focus on indie and experimental music.
3. Eli Enis - Enis is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like Revolver, Stereogum, and Bandcamp Daily. He has covered a range of genres, including psych-pop and indie rock.
4. Jemima Skala - Skala is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like The Line of Best Fit, Crack Magazine, and Bandcamp Daily. She covers a range of genres, with a focus on indie and alternative music.
5. Ian King - King is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like The Quietus and The Wire. He covers a range of genres, with a focus on experimental and avant-garde music.
6. Will Richards - Richards is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like NME, DIY Magazine, and The Line of Best Fit. He covers a range of genres, with a focus on indie and alternative music.
7. Colin Joyce - Joyce is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like Pitchfork, Bandcamp Daily, and Spin. He covers a range of genres, with a focus on experimental and electronic music.
8. Jonny Coleman - Coleman is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like The Fader, Pitchfork, and Rolling Stone. He covers a range of genres, with a focus on experimental and underground music.
9. Vrinda Jagota - Jagota is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like The Line of Best Fit, Clash Magazine, and Hype Machine. She covers a range of genres, with a focus on indie and alternative music.
10. Eli Schoop - Schoop is a writer and editor who has contributed to publications like Stereogum, Bandcamp Daily, and Vulture. He covers a range of genres, with a focus on indie and experimental music.

These writers have all covered emerging artists in genres similar to Sunstoney's, and may be good targets for outreach efforts. Of course, you should always research each writer carefully before reaching out, to ensure that they are a good fit for your goals and the artist's music. Good luck with your outreach efforts!
